translations.translation: Hell, where they will roast. What an evil resting-place!
Hell, in which they will burn. How vile a resting place!
Hell, where they will be roasted. An evil place to dwell!
They will suffer in hell. What a terrible dwelling!
Hell; which they shall enter; what an evil resting-place!
Hell! Where they will enter it, and worst (indeed) is that place to rest!
Hell; they shall enter it, so evil is the resting-place.
Gehenna, wherein they are roasted - an evil cradling!
Hell, where they will burn, an evil resting-place.
they will burn, in Hell, an evil resting place --
Hell, wherein they roast: a wretched couch.
hell, which they shall enter, an evil resting place.
Hell!- they will burn therein, - an evil bed (indeed, to lie on)!-
Hell! Where they will burn, and worst (indeed) is that place to rest!
They shall roast in (the Fire) of Gehenna, an evil cradling.
Hell; in which they will roast; what a miserable abode!
Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.
[38:56] Hell, which they will enter — an evil resting place!
(Hell, where they will burn) on the Day of Judgement, (an evil resting place) the Fire is an evil abode for them.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
يعني: { جَهَنَّمَ } البعد والخذلان وجحيم الطرد والحرمان { يَصْلَوْنَهَا } ويدخلون فيها بأنواع حسراتهم والزفرات بين أصناف العقارب والحيات
 وأنواع الحشرات المصورة لهم من سيئات أعمالهم التي أتوا بها في دار الاختبار ونشأة الاعتبار
 وبالجملة: { فَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ } [ص: 56] والفراش مهد أصحاب الجحيم وفراشهم

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ فبئس المِهادُ }: الفراش
 شبّه ما تحتهم من النار بالمهاد الذي يفرش للنائم
 والمخصوص محذوف
 أي: جهنم
